p: Ensure that the patient is hemodynamically stable and treat hypoglycemia, which is often present in viral encephalitis, instantly [ 13]. Treat seizures and raised ICP according to standard protocols [ 13], but because the pathogenesis of raised ICP, associated with viral encephalitis, is different to that of other contexts, further studies are essential to investigate the efficacy of specifically edema-lowering modalities [ 44]. Observe for autonomic instability. While results are pending treatment should be administered without delay and should include broad-spectrum antibiotics, often a third-generation cephalosporin and acyclovir [ 13].
